duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide primary care services to patients of all ages, including diagnosis, treatment, and preventive care.
Build and maintain patient relationships, ensuring continuity of care and personalized treatment plans.
Collaborate with medical specialists, hospitals, and healthcare professionals to coordinate patient care and referrals.
Stay abreast of medical developments and best practices, implementing evidence-based medicine in the provision of care.
Participate in quality improvement initiatives, maintaining compliance with industry regulations and standards.
Contribute to the practice's growth and development through community outreach and educational initiatives.

education_certification.credential: Doctor of Medicine (MD) or Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO) degree from an accredited medical school.
Board certification in Family Medicine or Internal Medicine.
